  • friendship circles /ˈfrɛndʃɪp ˈsɜːrkəlz/: 朋友圈
  • cluttered /ˈklʌtərd/: 凌乱的

docs.title: 2. Do you think it is very expensive to make a home look nice? Why or why not?
docs.text:
Sample Answer:

Not necessarily. If you shop for secondhand furniture and get creative with decoration, I think you can make your home look stylish on a budget. Also, the devil is in the detail, so another way to spend your money wisely is to buy small things that attract attention, for example, eye-catching wall art or pillows—they give the room a polished look without setting you back too much. And since the minimalist movement is all the rage right now, the simplest way to make your home look nice is to declutter it, though it's probably more expensive since you have to throw all the things away!

Advanced Vocabulary and Phrases:

  • shop for secondhand furniture /ʃɑːp fɔːr ˈsɛkəndˌhænd ˈfɜːrnɪʧər/: 购买二手家具

  • budget /ˈbʌdʒɪt/: 预算
  • devil is in the detail /ˈdɛvəl ɪz ɪn ðə ˈdiːteɪl/: 魔鬼在细节里（意指细节决定成败）
  • spend your money wisely /spɛnd jʊər ˈmʌni ˈwaɪzli/: 精明消费

  • throw all the things away /θroʊ ɔːl ðə θɪŋz əˈweɪ/: 丢弃所有东西

docs.title: 3. Why don't some people care about how their home looks? Why don't they care?
docs.text:
Sample Answer:

This sounds a bit condescending, doesn't it? Maybe they do care but they just cannot afford the maintenance. Or maybe they are too busy. Some people don't care about interior design because they prefer to spend more time outside. Home is where the heart is; it doesn't have to be beautiful or impressive, as long as it is functional and comfortable and you share it with people you love, it is a good home. For one, I am not interested in dusting knickknacks that are supposed to make my home look "nicer."

docs.title: IELTS Speaking Preparation: Part 3 - Different Types of Homes
1. In what ways is living in a flat/apartment better than living in a house?
docs.text:
Sample Answer:

There are many advantages to living in a flat or an apartment, especially if you have just started a graduate job or have moved to a big city. The most obvious one is, of course, costs. Not only is the rent of an apartment usually cheaper than the mortgage of a house, but you will also have lower living costs such as gas, water, and electricity because the square footage is smaller. If you don't have a car, then the location of your property could be crucial. It's much easier to find an apartment in a desirable city location, whereas houses are usually built in the suburbs—you'll have to endure the long commute every day.

Advanced Vocabulary and Phrases:

  • flat /flæt/: 公寓
  • apartment /əˈpɑːrtmənt/: 公寓
  • graduate job /ˈɡrædʒuət dʒɑːb/: 毕业后的第一份工作
  • costs /kɒsts/: 成本
  • rent /rɛnt/: 房租
  • mortgage /ˈmɔːrɡɪdʒ/: 房屋抵押贷款
  • living costs /ˈlɪvɪŋ kɒsts/: 生活开销
  • gas /ɡæs/: 燃气
  • water /ˈwɔːtər/: 水
  • electricity /ɪlɛkˈtrɪsɪti/: 电
  • square footage /skwɛər ˈfʊtɪdʒ/: 房屋面积
  • location /loʊˈkeɪʃən/: 位置
  • desirable city location /dɪˈzaɪərəbl ˈsɪti loʊˈkeɪʃən/: 城市较好的位置
  • endure the long commute /ɪnˈdjʊər ðə lɒŋ kəˈmjuːt/: 忍受长时间的通勤

docs.title: 2. Do you think homes will look different in the future? Why or why not?
docs.text:
Sample Answer:

Well, in terms of architecture and layout, I'm not sure if there will be any drastic changes in how homes look in the next few decades. After all, the most cutting-edge homes today still have many of the same features that homes had fifty years ago. We still have kitchens, living rooms, bedrooms, and bathrooms. We're still sitting on sofas, eating at tables, and sleeping on mattresses on bed frames. However, if I have to predict what is going to change, it seems a given that most of our electronics and appliances will only get better, and they are bound to change how we live our lives at home. For example, a smart home with all the appliances wirelessly connected and controlled by a single device is no longer science fiction. If I'm around in fifty years, I definitely want my house to be more efficient and green.

Advanced Vocabulary and Phrases:

  • architecture /ˈɑːrkɪtɛktʃər/: 建筑
  • layout /ˈleɪaʊt/: 布局
  • drastic changes /ˈdræstɪk ˈʧeɪnʤɪz/: 剧烈的变化

  • eating at tables /ˈiːtɪŋ æt ˈteɪbəlz/: 在桌子旁吃饭
  • sleeping on mattresses /ˈsliːpɪŋ ɒn mæˈtɛrəsɪz/: 睡在床垫上
  • bed frames /bɛd freɪmz/: 床架
  • electronics /ɪˌlɛktrɒˈnɪks/: 电子产品

  • controlled by a single device /kənˈtroʊld baɪ ə ˈsɪŋɡəl dɪˈvaɪs/: 由单一设备控制

  • efficient /ɪˈfɪʃənt/: 高效的
  • green /ɡriːn/: 绿色环保的

docs.title: 3. Do you agree that the kinds of homes people prefer change as they get older? Why or why not?
docs.text:
Sample Answer:

Yes, I agree. We all have different needs for accommodation at different stages of our lives. While a young graduate may be happy to share a flat in the city center with a stranger, a married couple with kids will have to think about space, privacy, neighborhood, and so on. As people get older, they are also more likely to own a property rather than rent one. Home ownership gives the family a sense of stability and security. It's also viewed as a hedge against inflation. Obviously, when so many factors come into play, your priorities and preferences change.

  • accommodation /əˌkɒməˈdeɪʃən/: 住所，住宿

docs.title: IELTS Speaking Preparation: Part 1 - Your Neighbourhood
docs.text: In the first part of the IELTS Speaking test, the examiner will introduce themselves and confirm your identity. They will then ask you questions related to your studies, work, accommodation, or other familiar topics. Below are some example questions and sample answers on the topic of Your Neighbourhood.

docs.title: 1. Do you like the neighbourhood you live in? [Why/Why not?]
docs.text:
Sample Answer:

Yes, absolutely. It is a place that I've been living in my whole life, and it means a lot to me. I'm fond of listening to the birds’ chirping and hearing my neighbours’ conversations each day. It seems that everything is harmonious around me.

Advanced Vocabulary and Phrases:

  • means a lot to me /miːnz ə lɒt tuː miː/: 对我很重要
  • chirping /ˈʧɜːrpɪŋ/: 鸟叫
  • be fond of /bi fɒnd əv/: 喜爱某事物
  • harmonious /hɑːrˈməʊniəs/: 和谐的

docs.title: 2. What do you do in your neighbourhood in your free time? [Why/Why not?]
docs.text:
Sample Answer:

The area around me is quite convenient. A supermarket is a stone's throw from my home, so if I'm free, I'll go there to buy some daily necessities. Apart from that, there's a park nearby. For me, the place is definitely a haven of tranquility. Whenever I've got spare time, I'll take a stroll there.

Advanced Vocabulary and Phrases:

  • a stone's throw /ə stəʊnz θrəʊ/: 距离很近
  • supermarket /ˈsuːpərˌmɑːrkɪt/: 超级市场
  • daily necessities /ˈdeɪli nəˈsɛsɪtiz/: 日常必需品
  • park /pɑːrk/: 公园
  • a haven of tranquility /ə ˈheɪvən əv trænˈkwɪlɪti/: 静谧场所
  • take a stroll /teɪk ə strəʊl/: 悠闲漫步

docs.title: 3. What new things would you like to have in your neighbourhood? [Why/Why not?]
docs.text:
Sample Answer:

Let's see, what new stuff would be added to the area? Oh, if there was a safe and secure parcel dropbox installed in the neighbourhood, everyone would be so pleased. You know, currently in my community, since most people have to work outside, many delivered packages are always piled up at the corner of a small convenience store. This has not only caused trouble for the owner, but the whole situation has made it hard to find one's delivered items. If everyone’s parcels could be placed in their own dropbox, it would be wonderful.

Advanced Vocabulary and Phrases:

  • safe and secure /seɪf ənd sɪˈkjʊər/: 安全而有保障的
  • parcel dropbox /ˈpɑːrsəl ˈdrɒpˌbɒks/: 快递箱
  • piled up /paɪld ʌp/: 堆积
  • convenience store /kənˈviːniəns stɔːr/: 便利店
  • wonderful /ˈwʌndərfʊl/: 美妙的

docs.title: 4. Would you like to live in another neighbourhood in your town or city? [Why/Why not?]
docs.text:
Sample Answer:

If I had loads of money, I'd love to move into a more convenient place. Actually, I've seen an apartment building in my city where there's a shopping centre on the ground floor. If I lived in that place, whenever I needed to buy something, I would just go downstairs. Isn't it a perfect place to live in?

Advanced Vocabulary and Phrases:

  • loads of /ləʊdz əv/: 很多
  • apartment building /əˈpɑːtmənt ˈbɪldɪŋ/: 公寓楼
  • shopping centre /ˈʃɒpɪŋ ˈsɛntər/: 购物中心
  • perfect place to live in /ˈpɜːrfɪkt pleɪs tuː lɪv ɪn/: 完美的居住地

Note: Practicing these responses and understanding the advanced vocabulary will help enhance your fluency and coherence during the IELTS Speaking test.

docs.title: IELTS Speaking Preparation: Part 2 - Describe a Website You Have Bought Something From
docs.text:
Describe a website you have bought something from.

You should say:

  • what the website is
  • what you bought from this website
  • how satisfied you were with what you bought
  • and explain what you liked and disliked about using this website.

Sample Answer:

A website I've bought an item from is a well-known one in my country, called Taobao.com.

Last month, I purchased an adorable costume for my cat from the website. It has a special design, featuring two fake arms on each side. What the owner needs to do is ensure the entire piece is put on the cat's forelegs, and then the magic happens—you can see the cat walking like a human. I bought the item mainly because I wanted to surprise my cat on his very first birthday. Additionally, it was on a big sale, so I snapped it up immediately when I saw the price tag.

After waiting for a few days, I received the piece of clothing. The moment I got it, I dressed my cat up, and he really looked like a cute person walking around the room. Seeing this made me laugh my head off. As you can see, I was very happy with the item, which was exactly as described on the creative shop. To be honest, I was quite curious about who came up with the idea of making a specially designed costume for cats.

Speaking of how I feel about the website, I'd say that in general, I'm a big fan of it. First of all, no matter what I want to buy, I can always find the right item on it. On top of that, once I make a purchase, the next time I visit the website, there are similar items recommended on the front page, which means the website knows me pretty well. However, this brings some problems. Sometimes, it's really hard for me to resist the temptation of scrolling through the items because almost every single item is something I like. During this process, time just slips away, and it becomes a big waste of time. So, I really need to set a time limit for using the website.

docs.title: IELTS Speaking Preparation: Part 3 - Shopping Online
1. What kinds of things do people in your country often buy from online shops?
docs.text:
Sample Answer:

Chinese people are fond of buying all kinds of stuff in the virtual world, including clothes, food, electronic devices—you name it. There are countless choices available. On top of that, E-retailers have always promoted their products by offering big discounts; it's hard for buyers to resist the temptation of making online purchases.

Advanced Vocabulary and Phrases:

  • virtual world /ˈvɜːrtʃuəl wɜːrld/: 虚拟世界
  • E-retailers /iː-ˈriːteɪlərz/: 网络零售商
  • offering big discounts /ˈɒfərɪŋ bɪɡ dɪsˈkaʊnts/: 提供巨大折扣
  • countless choices /ˈkaʊntləs ˈʧɔɪsɪz/: 无数选择
  • online purchases /ˈɒnˌlaɪn ˈpɜːrʧəsɪz/: 在线支付

docs.title: 2. Why has online shopping become so popular in many countries?
docs.text:
Sample Answer:

In my opinion, there are several reasons that make online shopping such a hit worldwide. First of all, people are totally into the activity because of its huge convenience. Online shopping is now possible on one's mobile phone; it's easy to access and the way of purchase is user-friendly, so almost all age groups are capable of learning how to do it within a few minutes. Additionally, you don't need to struggle through the crowd of people to reach the counter after choosing what to buy. Now, with your computer set up, you can just sit at your desk and have a mug of tea, enjoying the shopping time on the virtual store. So, there's no reason to avoid shopping online.

Advanced Vocabulary and Phrases:

  • such a hit /sʌʧ ə hɪt/: 如此流行
  • convenience /kənˈviːniəns/: 便利性
  • mobile phone /ˈməʊbaɪl fəʊn/: 手机
  • access /ˈæksɛs/: 访问，使用
  • way of purchase /weɪ əv ˈpɜːʧəs/: 购买方式
  • user-friendly /ˈjuːzər ˈfrɛndli/: 易于使用的
  • all age groups /ɔːl eɪdʒ ɡruːps/: 所有年龄层
  • struggle through the crowd of people /ˈstrʌɡl θruː ðə kraʊd əv ˈpiːpl/: 挣扎着穿过拥挤的人群
  • sit at your desk /sɪt æt jɔːr dɛsk/: 坐在桌前
  • virtual store /ˈvɜːrtʃuəl stɔːr/: 虚拟商店

docs.title: 3. What are some possible disadvantages of buying things from online shops?
docs.text:
Sample Answer:

There are a few main drawbacks of online shopping. One problem lies in the fact that what you see online might not be the same as what is delivered to you, since we can only see the pictures, not the actual products. In the end, you might be disappointed. Even worse, if you want to exchange the unsatisfactory items, you may find that you have to pay return shipping, which means you have to spend more money than you initially intended. This is another negative aspect of shopping on the Internet.

Advanced Vocabulary and Phrases:

  • drawbacks /ˈdrɔːbæks/: 缺点
  • delivered /dɪˈlɪvərd/: 送达
  • pictures /ˈpɪktʃərz/: 图片
  • disappointed /ˌdɪsəˈpɔɪntɪd/: 失望的
  • exchange /ɪksˈʧeɪnʤ/: 交换
  • unsatisfactory items /ʌnˌsætɪsˈfækʃənri ˈaɪtəmz/: 不满意的商品
  • return shipping /rɪˈtɜːrn ˈʃɪpɪŋ/: 退货的运费
  • negative aspect /ˈnɛɡətɪv ˈæspekt/: 负面因素

Note: Practicing these responses and understanding the advanced vocabulary will help enhance your fluency and coherence during the IELTS Speaking test.

docs.title: IELTS Speaking Preparation: Part 3 - Online Retail Businesses
1. Do you agree that the prices of all goods should be lower on internet shopping sites than in shops? Why or why not?
docs.text:
Sample Answer:

Yes, I tend to agree with that point. Compared with running a brick-and-mortar store, opening a virtual shop doesn't require worrying about the gross margin and overheads of operating a business in a shopping centre. E-retailers often lower the price of their products accordingly; this is why most consumers are drawn to online places to make purchases. However, if all items sold are much cheaper on the internet, there will probably be fewer people shopping in person. As a consequence, physical stores might disappear completely, which would cause troubles for the whole society, such as job losses, lack of social interaction, and so on.

Advanced Vocabulary and Phrases:

  • brick-and-mortar store /ˈbrɪk ænd ˈmɔːtər stɔːr/: 实体店
  • virtual shop /ˈvɜːrtʃuəl ʃɒp/: 虚拟商店
  • gross margin /ɡroʊs ˈmɑːrdʒɪn/: 毛利
  • overheads /ˈoʊvərhɛdz/: 运营成本
  • E-retailers /iː-ˈriːteɪlərz/: 网络零售商
  • drawn to /drɔn tuː/: 被吸引
  • job losses /dʒɒb ˈlɔːsɪz/: 失业
  • social interaction /ˈsoʊʃəl ˌɪntərˈækʃən/: 社交互动

docs.title: 2. Will large shopping malls continue to be popular, despite the growth of internet shopping? Why or why not?
docs.text:
Sample Answer:

Well, in spite of the increase in online shopping, it's fairly likely that shopping centres will remain welcomed in the future. Compared to shopping on the internet, physical stores offer people opportunities to socialize. They can share moments with friends and family during shopping or even interact with strangers, like the shopping assistants. This kind of face-to-face communication is much more effective than online interaction. Moreover, most shopping malls are not just places for shopping; they are also pleasant areas for having meals or engaging in recreational activities. These are experiences that people cannot replicate in the virtual world. So, as you can see, although virtual shops are increasing, it's still quite hard for the great malls to lose their popularity.

Advanced Vocabulary and Phrases:

  • in spite of /ɪn spaɪt əv/: 尽管
  • shopping centres /ˈʃɒpɪŋ ˈsɛntərz/: 购物中心
  • welcomed /ˈwɛlkəmɪd/: 受欢迎的
  • physical stores /ˈfɪzɪkl stɔːrz/: 实体店铺
  • socialize /ˈsoʊʃəlaɪz/: 社交
  • shopping assistants /ˈʃɒpɪŋ əˈsɪstənts/: 购物助理
  • face-to-face communication /feɪs-tuː-feɪs kəˌmjuːnɪˈkeɪʃən/: 面对面交流
  • engaging in recreational activities /ɪnˈɡeɪdʒɪŋ ɪn ˌrɛkrɪˈeɪʃənl ækˈtɪvətiz/: 参与娱乐活动
  • replicate /ˈrɛplɪkeɪt/: 复制

docs.title: 3. Do you think that some businesses (e.g., banks and travel agents) will only operate online in the future? Why or why not?
docs.text:
Sample Answer:

Well, it's really hard for me to say yes. I do admit that a large number of banks and travel agents are opening online services, which has provided people with huge convenience. In spite of this, I believe that there will always be some people who love to personally visit the branches, and there will still be some services that require one's presence at the physical locations. Therefore, I foresee that there will be fewer physical banks and travel agents, but these places are less likely to completely disappear.

Advanced Vocabulary and Phrases:

  • banks /bæŋks/: 银行
  • travel agents /ˈtrævəl ˈeɪdʒənts/: 旅行社
  • online services /ˈɒnˌlaɪn ˈsɜːrvɪsəz/: 网上服务
  • convenience /kənˈviːniəns/: 便利性
  • personally visit /ˌpɜːrsənˈæli ˈvɪzɪt/: 亲自访问
  • physical banks /ˈfɪzɪkl bæŋks/: 实体银行
  • completely disappear /kəmˈpliːtli ˌdɪsəˈpɪər/: 完全消失
  • foresee /fɔːrˈsiː/: 预见

Note: Practicing these responses and familiarizing yourself with the advanced vocabulary will help enhance your fluency and coherence during the IELTS Speaking test.

docs.title: writing
Essay 1
docs.text:
Question:

Some people believe that it is best to accept a bad situation, such as an unsatisfactory job or shortage of money, while others argue that it is better to try and improve such situations. Discuss both these views and give your own opinion.

Essay:

Some individuals contend that accepting a bad situation, such as an unsatisfactory job or financial hardship, is the most prudent approach, while others advocate for actively striving to enhance these circumstances. This essay will explore both perspectives before presenting my own viewpoint.

Those who advocate for acceptance argue that maintaining stability is paramount. They believe that enduring difficult circumstances can build resilience and patience. For instance, remaining in a challenging job might offer long-term career benefits and job security, providing a stable foundation for future opportunities. Additionally, accepting financial shortages without succumbing to panic can lead to more effective financial management and prudent savings. Consequently, proponents assert that perseverance in the face of adversity fosters personal growth and prepares individuals for future challenges.

Conversely, many believe that taking proactive steps to improve unfavorable situations is essential for personal and professional advancement. They argue that taking initiative can unlock better opportunities and enhance overall well-being. For example, seeking a more fulfilling job can significantly increase job satisfaction and facilitate career progression. Similarly, addressing financial issues through meticulous budgeting or exploring additional income streams can alleviate stress and improve one's quality of life. Therefore, supporters of this view maintain that proactive efforts are crucial for overcoming challenges and achieving success.

In my opinion, while acceptance can provide short-term stability and prevent unnecessary stress, striving to improve adverse situations is ultimately more beneficial. Proactive efforts lead to personal and professional development, enabling individuals to achieve their full potential and attain greater satisfaction in life.

Question:

Some people say that the main environmental problem of our time is the loss of particular species of plants and animals. Others say that there are more important environmental problems. Discuss both these views and give your own opinion.

Essay:

Some individuals assert that the primary environmental challenge of our era is the loss of specific plant and animal species, while others argue that there are more critical environmental issues. This essay will examine both viewpoints before offering my own perspective.

Advocates of the view that species loss is the foremost environmental problem emphasize that biodiversity is essential for ecosystem stability and overall planetary health. For example, the extinction of pollinators like bees can disrupt food production and agricultural economies, leading to broader economic and ecological repercussions. Furthermore, each species plays a unique role within its habitat, contributing to vital natural processes such as decomposition and nutrient cycling. Therefore, preserving species diversity is deemed crucial for maintaining ecological balance and ensuring the resilience of ecosystems against environmental changes.

Conversely, some argue that other environmental problems, such as climate change and pollution, are more pressing due to their widespread and immediate impacts on both natural and human systems. They contend that rising global temperatures can trigger extreme weather events, sea-level rise, and habitat loss, affecting millions of lives and destabilizing economies. Additionally, pollution of air and water sources poses significant health risks to humans and wildlife alike, undermining the very foundations of healthy ecosystems. Proponents of this perspective believe that addressing these broader issues will inherently benefit biodiversity and species preservation, making them more urgent priorities.

In my opinion, while the loss of species is undeniably a critical concern, it is intrinsically linked to larger environmental challenges like climate change and pollution. Therefore, prioritizing comprehensive solutions to these overarching issues is imperative for the effective conservation of biodiversity and the sustainability of our planet.

Question:

Some people say that music is a good way of bringing people of different cultures and ages together. To what extent do you agree or disagree with this opinion?

Essay:

Music is often hailed as a universal language that can bridge cultural and generational divides. I strongly agree with the opinion that music serves as an effective medium for uniting people of different cultures and ages, fostering mutual understanding and harmony.

Firstly, music transcends language barriers, enabling individuals from diverse backgrounds to connect on an emotional level. For example, a lively samba rhythm can unite people from various countries, allowing them to enjoy the same melody regardless of their native language. Additionally, music events such as concerts and festivals create environments where people of all ages can come together, share experiences, and build lasting memories. This shared enjoyment fosters a sense of community and belonging among participants, breaking down social and cultural barriers.

However, it is important to acknowledge that music alone may not entirely eliminate cultural and generational differences. While music can initiate interactions, deeper understanding requires more comprehensive efforts, including education and open dialogue. For instance, differing musical tastes and preferences can sometimes lead to misunderstandings or a lack of appreciation for each other's styles. Moreover, generational gaps in music preferences can create barriers in communication and mutual enjoyment. Therefore, while music is a powerful tool for connection, it should be complemented with other initiatives to fully bridge cultural and age-related divides.

In conclusion, music plays a significant role in uniting people from various cultures and age groups, but it should be part of a broader strategy to achieve complete social integration.

Question:

Nowadays many people choose to be self-employed, rather than to work for a company or organisation. Why might this be the case? What could be the disadvantages of being self-employed?

Essay:

In today’s society, an increasing number of individuals are opting to become self-employed instead of working for established companies or organizations. This shift can be attributed to several factors, but it also comes with its own set of challenges.

One primary reason for the rise in self-employment is the desire for greater flexibility and autonomy. Many people seek the ability to set their own schedules and make independent decisions about their work. For example, freelancers in the gig economy enjoy the freedom to choose projects that align with their interests and skills, allowing for a more personalized career path. Additionally, advancements in technology have made it easier to start and manage a business from virtually anywhere, reducing the barriers to entry for aspiring entrepreneurs. This technological empowerment enables individuals to operate efficiently without the need for significant initial investments or infrastructure.

However, self-employment also presents significant disadvantages that can impact individuals negatively. One major drawback is the lack of job security and stable income. Unlike salaried positions, self-employed individuals often face inconsistent earnings and financial uncertainty, which can lead to stress and anxiety. For instance, freelance graphic designers may experience periods of high demand followed by times with few projects, making it difficult to plan financially. Furthermore, self-employed individuals are responsible for all aspects of their business, including marketing, administration, and financial management, which can be overwhelming and detract from their core professional activities. This multifaceted responsibility can lead to burnout and reduce the quality of their primary work.

In conclusion, while self-employment offers flexibility and independence, it also entails financial instability and increased personal responsibility, making it essential for individuals to weigh the pros and cons carefully before making the transition.

Question

In some countries, owning a home rather than renting one is very important for people. Why might this be the case? Do you think this is a positive or negative situation? Give reasons for your answer and include any relevant examples from your own knowledge or experience.

Essay:

Owning a home is often regarded as a significant milestone in many countries, embodying profound cultural and economic significance. This emphasis on homeownership stems from the belief that it provides stability and security as well as investment opportunities, while others contend that it may impose financial burdens and limit mobility.

One primary reason people prioritize homeownership is the sense of stability and security it offers. Homeowners enjoy a permanent residence, free from the uncertainties associated with rental agreements and the looming threat of eviction. For instance, owning a house enables families to establish deep roots within a community, fostering robust social connections and support networks. Additionally, property ownership is perceived as a long-term investment that can appreciate over time, contributing to wealth accumulation and financial prosperity.

However, homeownership carries both advantages and disadvantages for individuals and society. On the positive side, it enhances personal satisfaction and pride, contributing to overall well-being and a sense of achievement. Conversely, the financial obligations of mortgage payments, maintenance costs, and property taxes can be substantial, particularly in high-cost regions. Furthermore, owning a home may restrict an individual's flexibility to relocate for better career opportunities or personal reasons, potentially hindering career advancement and personal growth.

In my opinion, while homeownership offers numerous benefits such as stability and investment potential, it is crucial to consider the associated financial responsibilities and possible restrictions it entails.

Question

In the future, nobody will buy printed newspapers or books because they will be able to read everything they want online without paying. To what extent do you agree or disagree with this statement? Give reasons for your answer and include any relevant examples from your own knowledge or experience.

Essay:

The rapid advancement of digital technology has revolutionized the way we consume information, leading some to predict that printed newspapers and books will become obsolete. I partially agree with this statement, as while digital reading is poised to dominate, there will still be a sustained demand for printed materials.

One significant advantage of online reading is its accessibility and convenience. Digital platforms enable users to access a vast repository of information instantly from anywhere, often at a lower cost or even for free. For example, e-books can be downloaded to various devices, eliminating the need for physical storage and allowing readers to carry multiple books simultaneously. Additionally, online newspapers offer real-time updates, providing the latest news without the delay inherent in print editions. These benefits make digital reading an appealing option for many, contributing to the decline of printed materials.

However, printed newspapers and books retain their relevance for several reasons. Many individuals appreciate the tactile experience of reading on paper, finding it more enjoyable and less straining on the eyes compared to screens. Moreover, printed materials do not rely on electronic devices or internet connectivity, making them accessible in environments where digital access is limited. For instance, books are often valued as collectibles and are passed down through generations, preserving cultural heritage. Furthermore, certain academic and professional fields continue to depend heavily on printed resources for their credibility and permanence.

In conclusion, while digital reading is likely to increasingly overshadow printed newspapers and books due to its convenience and accessibility, there will remain a niche market for printed materials driven by personal preferences and specific requirements.

Question

Some people say that advertising is extremely successful at persuading us to buy things. Other people think that advertising is so common that we no longer pay attention to it. Discuss both these views and give your own opinion.

Essay:

Advertising plays a crucial role in contemporary society, significantly influencing consumer behavior and shaping market dynamics. While some assert that advertising is highly effective in persuading consumers to purchase products, others argue that its ubiquity has rendered it ineffective.

Proponents of advertising’s persuasive power emphasize how strategically designed campaigns can substantially boost sales and brand recognition. For example, meticulously crafted advertisements for new smartphone models can generate excitement and drive consumer interest, leading to increased sales figures. Furthermore, advertisements often tap into emotions and aspirations, making products appear essential. Celebrity endorsements and compelling visuals enhance the persuasive impact, encouraging consumers to prefer one brand over another.

Conversely, the saturation of advertising in daily life has led to consumer desensitization. With advertisements omnipresent across various platforms—television, social media, billboards—individuals have become adept at ignoring them. The prevalence of ad blockers and the habitual skipping of commercials exemplify a growing trend of advertisement avoidance. Additionally, the repetitive nature of ads can incite irritation, diminishing their effectiveness and even fostering negative brand perceptions. Consequently, some believe that the sheer volume of advertising has undermined its ability to influence purchasing decisions.

In my opinion, while advertising remains a potent tool for shaping consumer behavior, its efficacy is diminishing due to overexposure and consumer fatigue.

docs.title: Essay 4
docs.text:
Question

In some cultures, children are often told that they can achieve anything if they try hard enough. What are the advantages and disadvantages of giving children this message? Give reasons for your answer and include any relevant examples from your own knowledge or experience.

Essay:

Encouraging children by affirming that they can achieve anything through sufficient effort is a prevalent practice in many cultures. While this message can inspire and motivate, it also carries potential drawbacks that warrant careful consideration.

One significant advantage of this message is that it cultivates a strong work ethic and resilience in children. Believing that hard work can overcome obstacles fosters persistence and dedication, which are essential traits for personal and professional success. For example, a child who is encouraged to excel academically through diligent study is more likely to develop effective study habits and a commitment to lifelong learning. Additionally, this positive reinforcement can enhance self-esteem and confidence, empowering children to embrace challenges and pursue their goals with determination.

However, there are notable disadvantages to this approach. Telling children they can achieve anything may set unrealistic expectations, leading to disappointment and frustration when they encounter failures. For instance, a child consistently told they can become a professional athlete might experience significant stress and anxiety if they lack the necessary talent or suffer injuries. Furthermore, this message can overlook the importance of external factors such as socio-economic status, access to resources, and innate abilities, which play crucial roles in achieving success. Consequently, children might develop a distorted perception of reality, believing that effort alone is sufficient to overcome all barriers.

In my opinion, while encouraging children to strive for their goals is beneficial, it is equally important to teach them about the complexities and challenges they may face.

IELTS Speaking Preparation: Part 1 - Games
docs.text: In the first part of the IELTS Speaking test, the examiner will introduce themselves and confirm your identity. They will then ask you questions related to familiar topics. Below are some example questions and sample answers on the topic of Games.

docs.title: 1. What games are popular in your country? [Why?]
docs.text:
Sample Answer:

I would say reality shows and talent shows are probably the most popular types of TV programmes in my country. However, focusing on traditional games, children enjoy playing games like marbles and hopscotch. Tug of war is also highly popular, which is a game that directly pits two teams against each other in a test of strength. During my childhood, hopscotch was my favorite game because it was simple yet engaging. These games are popular because they promote physical activity, teamwork, and friendly competition, making them enjoyable for both children and adults.

docs.title: 2. Do you play any games? [Why/Why not?]
docs.text:
Sample Answer:

Yes, I enjoy playing competitive games because the winner feels like they have achieved something significant. In real life, experiences are inherently competitive, and I believe it's important not to pull the wool over children's eyes by making them think that they'll never have to compete with anyone. The idea that "everyone's a winner" is rather naive. Playing competitive games helps me develop a strong sense of achievement, resilience, and strategic thinking, which are valuable skills in both personal and professional settings.

docs.title: 3. How do people learn to play games in your country?
docs.text:
Sample Answer:

Games were quite simple a few decades ago. However, one significant difference in modern times is that we now have thousands of complicated computer games to choose from. Nowadays, it’s pretty easy to find tutorials and breakthroughs on the Internet that help players learn new games. Additionally, children often learn traditional games from older family members or through school activities, which fosters a sense of cultural continuity and community bonding.

docs.text:
Sample Answer:

Absolutely, games and sports are very important. They help relieve stress and exercise the body, contributing to overall physical health. Moreover, playing games teaches individuals about good sportsmanship and fair play, which are essential for personal development. Additionally, games improve hand-eye coordination and cognitive skills, such as problem-solving and strategic planning. These benefits make games a valuable part of both personal and social life.

docs.title: IELTS Speaking Preparation: Part 2 - Describe an Open-Air or Street Market Which You Enjoyed Visiting
docs.text:
Describe an open-air or street market which you enjoyed visiting. You should say:

  • where the market is
  • what the market sells
  • how big the market is
  • and explain why you enjoyed visiting this market.

Sample Answer:

I'd like to talk about a vibrant street market I visited in London that left a lasting impression on me. It's located just a two-minute bus ride from my hotel in the city center. The market is tucked away in a narrow alley, making it a hidden gem despite its central location. If you're looking for clothes or accessories, this market is definitely the place to be. However, be cautious with your wallet unless you're prepared to make some purchases, as the variety and quality of items can be quite tempting!

The market is much larger than it appears from the outside. Once you step inside, you'll find a sprawling array of stalls specializing in everything you can think of—from handmade jewelry and vintage clothing to unique home décor and artisanal snacks. The massive range of snack bars, cafes, and various shops ensures that visitors can spend hours exploring without getting bored.

One of the main reasons I enjoyed visiting this market was the sheer diversity of products available. Whether you're a fashion enthusiast, a food lover, or someone looking for unique souvenirs, there's something for everyone. Additionally, the atmosphere is always lively and bustling, filled with the sounds of vendors calling out their goods and the aroma of freshly prepared street food.

Another highlight of this market is the regular events they host, such as live music performances and cultural exhibitions, which add an extra layer of enjoyment to the shopping experience. Personally, I visited the market on a Wednesday when they were offering a 10% discount on selected items, which was a fantastic opportunity to snag some high-quality designer pieces at affordable prices. The friendly and approachable vendors also made the experience more pleasant, as they were always ready to help and engage in conversations.

Overall, this street market is a shopper's paradise. Its strategic location, extensive variety of products, and vibrant atmosphere make it a must-visit destination for both locals and tourists alike.

docs.title: IELTS Speaking Preparation: Part 3 - Shopping at Markets
1. Do people in your country enjoy going to open-air markets that sell things like food or clothes or old objects? Which type of market is more popular? Why?
docs.text:
Sample Answer:

I think most Chinese people enjoy shopping at open-air markets. Young people particularly like to wander around side-street stalls and open-air flea markets. The clothes sold there are competitively priced and fashionable, which makes them attractive to the younger generation. Additionally, these markets cater to the needs of young people by allowing them to bargain with ease. Although there are modern supermarkets in China, older people prefer to buy the freshest meat and vegetables at open-air wet markets. Unlike in the big food chains, shoppers develop a certain relationship with the vendors, allowing them to learn how the vegetables have been grown and who produced them. This creates a sense of security over the origin of the food, making wet markets particularly popular among the older generation.

docs.title: 2. Do you think markets are more suitable places for selling certain types of things? Which ones? Why do you think this is?
docs.text:
Sample Answer:

In my humble opinion, markets are supposed to be like giant yard sales with a wide range of old, interesting items and knick-knacks. You can see troll dolls living next to antique typewriters; you may find a wall clock you've always been longing for. During the weekend, I always look for antiques or vintage clothes and jewelries. I think an antique flea market is a very fascinating place. I prefer to browse for antiques and collectibles because they have been part and parcel of my life. Markets provide a unique environment where unique and rare items can be found, making them more suitable for selling things like antiques, vintage goods, and collectibles rather than mass-produced items.

docs.title: 3. Do you think young people feel the same about shopping at markets as older people? Why is that?
docs.text:
Sample Answer:

I don't think young people feel the same about shopping at markets as older people do. Current markets are filled with lots of branded and cheap goods, which fascinate the younger generation. Pocket money or salaries from part-time jobs have made shopping a favorite pastime for present youths. Young people enjoy the variety and affordability of products available at the markets. On the other hand, older people have different preferences; they visit vegetable markets for the freshest vegetables and fruits and are more likely to buy clothes in brand stores to guarantee the quality. While young people are attracted to the competitive pricing and the ability to bargain, older people prioritize quality and freshness, leading to different shopping experiences and preferences between the generations.

docs.title: IELTS Speaking Preparation: Part 3 - Shopping in General
1. What do you think are the advantages of buying things from shops rather than markets?
docs.text:
Sample Answer:

First and foremost, the customer service in shops is superior to that in markets. There are salespeople absolutely everywhere you look, and they are very polite. I have never been so impressed with the staff at upscale designer boutiques in my life; they are not snooty and even encourage me to try things on. Besides, shops offer the convenience of extended shopping hours, which can extend far into the evening or even operate 24 hours a day. This means there's less stress in making it to the shops on time. Last but not least, in big shops, children can be left in a play area while parents do their shopping, reducing stress and preventing them from being pestered into buying unnecessary items. However, markets are somewhat inconvenient in these respects, lacking the structured environment and amenities that shops provide.

docs.title: 2. How does advertising influence what people choose to buy? Is this true for everyone?
docs.text:
Sample Answer:

While you may be taking advertising for granted, it does seek to influence what everyone spends their money on. Many people don't believe that they're susceptible to being influenced, let alone manipulated by advertising. However, it wouldn't be so omnipresent if it didn't work. Advertising informs people of the existence of products they might be interested in buying. People are more willing to go with what's familiar than what's not. In media, people are usually influenced by what's "hot" in the products they see in TV shows, movies, or commercials. Generally, that type of advertising just sits in people's minds until they actually see the product at a store. It entices people to buy sooner or later.

docs.title: 3. Do you think that any recent changes in the way people live have affected general shopping habits? Why is this?
docs.text:
Sample Answer:

With today's busy lifestyle, there's a growing trend towards shopping online. E-commerce has been around for a long time and is breaking into traditional markets more than ever before. Not just books, CDs, and holiday trips can be bought online, but all sorts of other products and services that were unimaginable in the past are now available. Besides, supermarkets and convenience stores have stayed open for longer hours to meet the needs of white-collar workers. This shift has made shopping more convenient and accessible, allowing people to purchase items at any time that suits them, thus significantly altering general shopping habits.

docs.title: IELTS Speaking Preparation: Part 1 - Giving Gifts
docs.text: In the first part of the IELTS Speaking test, the examiner will introduce themselves and confirm your identity. They will then ask you questions related to familiar topics. Below are some example questions and sample answers on the topic of Giving Gifts.

docs.title: 1. When do people give gifts or presents in your country?
docs.text:
Sample Answer:

Chinese people give gifts on many festivals, and there are some hard-and-fast rules to gift-giving in China. For example, under no circumstances should you give a clock or a watch as a gift because it symbolises the end of your life, and you may cause offence. Other occasions for gift-giving include birthdays, weddings, and the Lunar New Year, where exchanging gifts is a way to show respect and strengthen relationships.

docs.title: 2. Do you ever take a gift when you visit someone in their home? [Why/Why not?]
docs.text:
Sample Answer:

Yes, it's not necessary, but it's always thoughtful to do so. People think it's a nice gesture if you bring a small gift when visiting someone's household. It shows you appreciate being invited and that you want to repay the favor. Bringing a gift can also make the host feel more welcomed and valued, strengthening the bond between the visitor and the host.

docs.title: 3. When did you last receive a gift? [What was it?]
docs.text:
Sample Answer:

My girlfriend gave me a watch a few weeks ago because she thought I'd like it. It's not pricey, but the thought counts even more. I was very touched by her thoughtfulness. The watch is stylish and practical, and every time I wear it, I am reminded of her kindness and the special occasion when I received it.

Advanced Vocabulary and Phrases:

  • pricey /ˈpraɪzi/: 昂贵的

docs.title: 4. Do you enjoy looking for gifts for people? [Why/Why not?]
docs.text:
Sample Answer:

No, I don't enjoy looking for gifts for people. It can be pretty tricky trying to find the perfect gift, especially if the recipient is already well-off. I don't have enough time to get clues by guessing what they'd like based on their hobbies and interests. Also, I'm rather tight-fisted when it comes to money, making the process even more stressful. Finding a meaningful gift requires effort and creativity, which I find challenging and time-consuming.

docs.title: IELTS Speaking Preparation: Part 2 - Describe Something You Did That Was New or Exciting
docs.text:
Describe something you did that was new or exciting. You should say:

  • what you did
  • where and when you did this
  • who you shared the activity with
  • and explain why this activity was new or exciting for you.

Sample Answer:

I'd like to talk about attending a classical music concert for the first time, which was both new and exciting for me. My father gave me this as a birthday gift—tickets to the concert of Beethoven's Ninth Symphony. Prior to this, I had never been inside a music hall, so it was a completely new experience.

On a Friday night last spring, my friends and I went to the local music hall together. It was our first visit to this venue, and everything went surprisingly smoothly, including traffic, parking, the souvenir stand, and the restrooms. The evening was a great night out, and I thoroughly enjoyed every moment.

The concert featured many popular light classics, and the performance quality was exceptional. The acoustics in the hall were fantastic, attracting many world-famous artists to perform there. The sound was clear, full-bodied, and clean for every vocal part, and the mix was perfect. I was very impressed by the terrific ambiance and intimacy of the hall. It is highly recommended and considered the best concert hall in the city—a place not to be missed!

What made this activity particularly exciting was the livelihood and energy of the performers and the audience. Listening to Beethoven's Ninth Symphony in such an esteemed venue was an unforgettable experience that deepened my appreciation for classical music. The combination of excellent acoustics, skilled musicians, and the vibrant atmosphere made it a truly memorable night.

docs.title: IELTS Speaking Preparation: Part 3 - Doing New Things
1. Why do you think some people like doing new things?
docs.text:
Sample Answer:

Trying new things often involves high risk, but despite this, some people prefer to face new challenges rather than follow a routine. I believe the main reason they enjoy trying new things is their adventurous character. By nature, I am an adventurous person. My mother used to say that she struggled hard to stop me from climbing trees when I was young. Maybe I displayed my adventurous character from my childhood itself. I would rather try new things as opposed to repeating the same old activities. This inclination towards novelty helps individuals grow, learn new skills, and keep life exciting and fulfilling.

docs.title: 2. What problems can people have when they try new activities for the first time?
docs.text:
Sample Answer:

When it comes to doing something out of the realm of experience, people may face several challenges. Firstly, they might suffer from a lack of motivation to engage in the activity, especially if nothing interests them initially. It's crucial for individuals to know how to motivate themselves, as I believe it is one of the most important factors leading a person towards success. Additionally, some people pressure themselves and become extremely worried about making mistakes. This can impose a lot of pressure on them. To overcome these issues, keeping calm is essential. Developing confidence and maintaining a positive mindset can help individuals navigate the uncertainties of trying new activities.

Advanced Vocabulary and Phrases:

  • out of the realm of experience /aʊt əv ðə riːlm əv ɪkˈspɪərɪəns/: 经验之外的

docs.title: 3. Do you think it's best to do new things on your own or with other people? Why?
docs.text:
Sample Answer:

I believe it's best to do new things with other people rather than on your own. Personally, I'm scared of trying new things on my own and I'm used to having friends tag along with me. When I do new things without any company, I may feel awkward and fear that I will make a complete fool out of myself by either being too quiet or babbling. My mind often tells me that I'm stupid while everyone else is intelligent, which makes me feel inadequate. However, if I bring a friend along, I behave normally. I think being with others is essential because that's how society functions. Look at any animal group, like ants or lions—pack animals must work together for the group to survive. Having companions not only makes the experience more enjoyable but also provides support and reduces anxiety.

docs.title: IELTS Speaking Preparation: Part 3 - Learning New Things
1. What kinds of things do children learn to do when they are very young? How important are these things?
docs.text:
Sample Answer:

Young children should learn how to cook and do other chores, such as sweeping and changing a light bulb, because this will prepare them for the future when they leave the nest. These activities help them build responsibility and earn respect from their parents. That's what most children are missing today. There is nothing worse than seeing teenagers live at home and letting their parents do all the work. Parents need to help them become prepared for the real world and enable them to become capable individuals ready to cope with life.

docs.title: 2. Do you think children and adults learn to do new things in the same way? How is their learning style different?
docs.text:
Sample Answer:

In my perspective, children and adults learn to do new things in totally different ways. Young children are natural learners and are naturally motivated to learn about new things. Especially, preschoolers learn differently from adults. Play is essential to their learning, and it is the main way children discover new things. On the other hand, adults learn new things through relevant experiences they already have. They fit the new information into their existing skills. Additionally, adults are generally much more receptive to learning when they understand the new information being taught. This difference is primarily due to the distinct stages of cognitive and emotional development between children and adults.

  • natural learners /ˈnæʃərəl ˈlɜːrnərz/: 天生的学习者

docs.title: 3. Some people say that it is more important to be able to learn new things now than it was in the past. Do you agree or disagree with that? Why?
docs.text:
Sample Answer:

Frankly, I agree with that statement. Now, we are under constant pressure to learn new things, which can be both daunting and exhilarating. Some pundits deride the current era as just another bubble, but whether it is or not, new and heady technologies are emerging every day. People have to have the ability to keep pace with the times. No one can discount the way that mobile technology and other breakthroughs are changing our way of life. People around the globe should be able to catch up with these advancements. Comparing people today to those of the 1970s or before, never before have we had such luxury in terms of access to information and learning resources. That's partially a good thing because it fosters continuous personal and professional growth.

docs.title: IELTS Speaking Preparation: Part 1 - Telephoning
docs.text: In the first part of the IELTS Speaking test, the examiner will introduce themselves and confirm your identity. They will then ask you questions related to familiar topics. Below are some example questions and sample answers on the topic of Telephoning.

docs.title: 1. How often do you make telephone calls? [Why/Why not?]
docs.text:
Sample Answer:

I make telephone calls quite frequently every day. When I travel to a foreign country, making calls becomes more expensive due to roaming charges. However, I believe that within Europe, these roaming charges are gradually decreasing. When I visit other countries, I usually purchase a local SIM card and insert it into an old phone, using it as a pay-as-you-go phone. This approach helps me manage costs effectively while staying connected with family and friends.

docs.title: IELTS Speaking Preparation: Part 2 - Describe a Journey
docs.text:
Describe a journey [e.g., by car, plane, boat] that you remember well. You should say:

  • where you went
  • how you travelled
  • why you went on the journey
  • and explain why you remember this journey well.

Sample Answer:

After finishing a four-year degree in Civil Engineering, I decided to take a break from studying buildings, roads, and bridges and headed to South Korea. I was having a fab time there. Travelling by train, I kept myself occupied by looking out of the window at the landscapes as they flashed by. I went with a good friend, and we spent a lot of time together. We had memorable conversations on the long train journeys about life, society, religion—all very deep topics.

When I was a little girl, I heard that South Korea, even though it is a small country, has its unique culture where traditions and innovations, old and new, coexist. I wanted to feast my eyes and experience this culture at the same time.

I'll never forget this trip because it was the first time I was travelling without a home base. Most of the cities in Korea are perfectly safe, as they are well-populated and every major venue, shopping area, and tourist destination is safe, well-lit, and properly patrolled. Even when I go out at night as a single woman, I'm not scared. Cheju Island has many wonderful walking areas, lots of hiking trails, and beautiful beaches to explore by foot. The food overall was very good and similar to what a lot of high-end Korean places serve in China. Since it was a vacation, it was pretty easy to slip into the relaxed Korean lifestyle. The trip was wonderful and left a lasting impression on me.

docs.title: IELTS Speaking Preparation: Part 3 - Benefits of International Travel
1. What do you think people can learn from travelling to other countries? Why?
docs.text:
Sample Answer:

Traveling to other countries offers a wealth of learning opportunities. It exposes individuals to diverse cultures and historical significance that they might not encounter in their daily lives. For instance, when someone visits a country with a rich history, they gain firsthand experience of its traditions, architectural marvels, and societal norms. Additionally, immersing oneself in a foreign culture is one of the most effective ways to learn a new language. Being surrounded by native speakers and engaging in everyday conversations accelerates language acquisition far more than classroom learning. Furthermore, travelers often develop a deeper understanding and appreciation of different material lifestyles and attitudes towards various aspects of life, such as work, family, and leisure. This broadens their perspective, making them more open-minded and adaptable in an increasingly globalized world.

docs.title: 2. Can travel make a positive difference to the economy of a country? How?
docs.text:
Sample Answer:

Absolutely, travel can significantly boost a country's economy in multiple ways. Tourism is one of the most prominent sectors that contribute to economic growth. When an increasing number of tourists visit a country, it benefits various industries, including the airline industry, hospitality, food and lodging, and retail businesses. For example, airlines experience higher demand, leading to increased revenue and potentially more job opportunities. Similarly, hotels, restaurants, and local shops see a surge in customers, which boosts their sales and profits. Additionally, tourism can lead to the development of small-scale industries, such as local crafts and souvenirs, providing income to local artisans and entrepreneurs. As tourists explore different regions, they spend money on local attractions, transportation, and entertainment, further stimulating the economy. Moreover, the per capita income tends to rise as businesses expand to cater to the needs of tourists, and the national economy benefits from the overall increase in economic activities. Thus, travel not only enhances cultural exchange but also plays a crucial role in economic prosperity.

docs.title: 3. Do you think a society can benefit if its members have experience of travelling to other countries? In what ways?
docs.text:
Sample Answer:

Yes, I strongly believe that a society can greatly benefit from its members' experiences of traveling to other countries. When individuals travel abroad, they bring back valuable knowledge and cultural insights that can be applied to improve various aspects of their home society. For example, exposure to different public transportation systems can inspire improvements in local infrastructure. Personally, after my trip to South Korea, I was encouraged to write to our mayor to advocate for the resumption of train services, aiming to benefit from the convenient public transport similar to what my European friends enjoy. This initiative could help lessen congestion on our roads, making daily commutes more efficient and environmentally friendly.

Moreover, travelers often develop a greater sense of global awareness and empathy towards people from different backgrounds. This can lead to a more inclusive and harmonious society, where diversity is appreciated and respected. Additionally, the economic benefits brought by returning travelers—such as increased consumer spending and investment—can contribute to the overall prosperity of the community. By sharing their experiences and implementing the best practices they observed, individuals can drive positive change and foster a culture of continuous improvement and innovation within their society.

docs.title: IELTS Speaking Preparation: Part 1 - Bicycles
docs.text: In the first part of the IELTS Speaking test, the examiner will introduce themselves and confirm your identity. They will then ask you questions related to familiar topics such as your studies, work, accommodation, or other everyday subjects. Below are some example questions and sample answers on the topic of Bicycles.

docs.title: 1. How popular are bicycles in your home town? [Why?]
docs.text:
Sample Answer:

Bicycles are less popular in my hometown than they were ten years ago. This decline is primarily because our living conditions have been advancing rapidly, allowing more people to afford private cars for commuting to work or school. Additionally, the government has been paving more roads and expressways to accommodate the increasing number of automobile owners. As a result, many people prefer the convenience and comfort of cars over bicycles for their daily transportation needs.

  • accommodate /əˈkɒmədeɪt/: 容纳

  • convenience and comfort /kənˈviːniəns ənd ˈkʌmfərt/: 便利和舒适
  • daily transportation needs /ˈdeɪli ˌtrænspɔːrˈteɪʃən niːdz/: 日常交通需求

docs.title: 2. How often do you ride a bicycle? [Why/Why not?]
docs.text:
Sample Answer:

I ride a bicycle to work every day because it is faster than walking, and I don't have to get on a crowded bus. Plus, the traffic is always heavy in the big city, especially during the rush hour. People can get stuck on the road for two or more hours, so obviously, a bicycle is the best way of transportation. Riding a bike allows me to avoid the stress of traffic jams and helps me stay fit and healthy.

Advanced Vocabulary and Phrases:

  • heavy traffic /ˈhɛvi ˈtræfɪk/: 交通拥堵

  • stay fit and healthy /steɪ fɪt ənd ˈhɛlθi/: 保持健康

docs.title: 3. Do you think that bicycles are suitable for all ages? [Why/Why not?]
docs.text:
Sample Answer:

I don't believe bicycles are suitable for all ages, especially for children in China. It's dangerous for kids to ride bicycles because there are many cars that turn very fast when crossing intersections. I think that kids need to wear helmets and other protective gear to ensure their safety. Unfortunately, I hardly ever see anyone wearing any kind of protective equipment, which increases the risk of accidents. Therefore, while bicycles can be a great mode of transport, appropriate safety measures must be in place to protect younger riders.

Advanced Vocabulary and Phrases:

  • suitable for all ages /ˈsuːtəbl fɔːr ɔːl eɪdʒɪz/: 适合所有年龄段

  • protect younger riders /prəˈtɛkt ˈjʌŋər ˈraɪdərz/: 保护年轻骑手
  • risk of accidents /rɪsk əv ˈæksɪdənts/: 事故风险

docs.title: 4. What are the advantages of a bicycle compared to a car? [Why?]
docs.text:
Sample Answer:

The idea of riding a bike often brings a sense of nostalgia for the times when we were younger. However, if you stop to think about it, there are many benefits to riding a bicycle compared to a car. Bicycles offer physical, financial, and environmental benefits. Physically, cycling helps improve fitness and overall health. Financially, bicycles are much cheaper to maintain and use than cars, saving money on fuel and repairs. Environmentally, bicycles produce no emissions, making them a greener mode of transportation. Additionally, cycling can reduce traffic congestion and the overall carbon footprint of a city. These reasons make cycling a great choice for those seeking a healthier and more sustainable lifestyle.

docs.title: IELTS Speaking Preparation: Part 2 - Describe a Person Who Has Done a Lot of Work to Help People
docs.text:
Describe a person who has done a lot of work to help people. You should say:

  • who this person is/was
  • where this person lives/lived
  • what he/she has done to help people
  • and explain how you know about this person.

Sample Answer:

I'd like to tell you about my close friend, Sam, who has always been dedicated to helping others. I met Sam when we were both only five years old, and he quickly became my best friend. When I think of him, what stands out the most is his constantly smiling face, his sense of humor, and his warm and caring disposition that made his inner self truly beautiful.

Sam and I lived in the same neighbourhood, where teens and adults alike paid tribute to him. They described him as a good-hearted, quiet yet outgoing boy who loved basketball. I'll always remember him because he was my closest companion before he left home to attend university.

One day, a few years ago, we were both working at Starbucks, and it was pouring outside. Before the store was supposed to close, Sam noticed a woman walking without an umbrella in the heavy rain while holding a baby. Without hesitation, he grabbed his umbrella and ran outside to offer her shelter. He asked, “Madam, do you want an umbrella?" She was so happy and thanked Sam profusely. This act of kindness exemplified his compassion and willingness to help others in need.

Sam was always concerned for others and ready to assist those in trouble. As a result of his virtuous cycle, others were more than willing to help him whenever he needed assistance. Additionally, he always lent me a hand whenever I was in trouble or had a puzzled and anxious look on my face. His support made a significant difference in my life.

Nowadays, we live on opposite sides of the world and lead very different lives. However, whenever I receive a call from him, my heart beats like a drum, and just hearing his voice can make me smile so big that my cheeks hurt. He always tries his hardest to protect me and ensure my well-being. If only the world were full of people like him, we would all feel much safer and more supported.

Advanced Vocabulary and Phrases:

  • ensure well-being /ɪnˈʃʊr wɛl-ˈbiːɪŋ/: 确保福祉
  • supported /səˈpɔːrtɪd/: 得到支持的

docs.title: IELTS Speaking Preparation: Part 3 - Helping Other People in the Community
1. What are some of the ways people can help others in the community? Which is the most important?
docs.text:
Sample Answer:

There are numerous ways people can contribute to their community. One common method is assisting with chores, such as helping elderly neighbors with household tasks. Additionally, volunteer work plays a significant role; for example, I personally walk dogs for the local animal shelter and visit children in hospitals to read to the elderly. These activities, though seemingly small, make a substantial difference in people's lives. Another important avenue is mentoring at community clubs, where teens are guided and supported. School guidance counselors often sponsor programs that encourage students to create skits with positive messages, fostering a sense of responsibility and empathy among the youth. Among these, volunteer work is the most important as it directly addresses immediate needs and builds a stronger, more compassionate community.

Advanced Vocabulary and Phrases:

  • chores /ʧɔːrz/: 家务

  • compassionate community /kəmˈpæʃənət kəˈmjuːnɪti/: 富有同情心的社区

docs.title: 2. Why do you think some people like to help other people?
docs.text:
Sample Answer:

I believe some people are driven to help others because they are willing to put themselves in other people's shoes. This ability to empathize fosters a deep sense of compassion, providing a strong motivation to assist those in need. Instead of viewing volunteering as a one-sided act of giving to those less fortunate, many see it as an exchange where mutual support is possible. Most individuals will find themselves in a position of needing help at some point in their lives. Therefore, helping others today could mean receiving support tomorrow when you might be the one in need. This reciprocal relationship encourages a culture of generosity and solidarity within the community.

Advanced Vocabulary and Phrases:

  • put themselves in other people's shoes /pʊt ðɛmˈsɛlvz ɪn ˈʌðər ˈpiːplz ʃuːz/: 从他人的角度思考
  • empathize /ˈɛmpəθaɪz/: 同理

  • reciprocal relationship /ˌrɛsɪˈprɒkəl rɪˌleɪʃənˈʃɪp/: 互惠关系
  • culture of generosity /ˈkʌltʃər əv ˌdʒɛnəˈrɒsəti/: 慷慨的文化
  • solidarity /ˌsɒlɪˈdærəti/: 团结

docs.title: 3. Some people say that people help others in the community more now than they did in the past. Do you agree or disagree? Why?
docs.text:
Sample Answer:

I disagree with the notion that people are helping others in the community more now than in the past. In my observation, individuals today are often more arrogant and self-centered compared to previous generations. There's a noticeable decline in patience and tolerance towards one another, with narcissism and hatred on the rise in both rural and urban areas. Particularly, the wealthy tend to focus on accumulating and attaining wealth, whereas those with fewer resources often spend more time with friends and loved ones. This shift in priorities has led to a decrease in communal support and volunteerism. Additionally, the fast-paced modern lifestyle leaves little time for altruistic activities, making it less likely for people to engage in helping others regularly. Therefore, I believe that the spirit of community assistance has diminished rather than strengthened over time.

Advanced Vocabulary and Phrases:

  • arrogant /ˈærəɡənt/: 傲慢的

docs.title: IELTS Speaking Preparation: Part 3 - Community Services
1. What types of services, such as libraries or health centres, are available to the people who live in your area? Do you think there are enough of them?
docs.text:
Sample Answer:

In my community, there are a variety of essential neighbourhood conveniences that cater to the diverse needs of residents. These include grocery store chains, dry cleaners, barbers, and a wide range of restaurants that cater to different tastes and preferences. Additionally, there are ample natural spaces for enjoying the outdoors, such as parks and walking trails, as well as a well-equipped gym that meets personal fitness needs.

Furthermore, the area boasts several coffeehouses and bars where people can hang out and socialize, fostering a strong sense of community. Auto-related amenities like car washes and fueling stations are also readily available, ensuring that residents have access to necessary services without having to travel far. While these services are too numerous to mention individually, I believe the community is well-served in terms of accessibility and variety. However, there is always room for improvement, especially in expanding services that cater to the elderly and other vulnerable groups to ensure inclusivity for all residents.

Advanced Vocabulary and Phrases:

  • neighbourhood conveniences /ˌneɪbərˈhʊd kənˈviːniənsəz/: 社区便利设施

  • well-equipped gym /ˌwɛlɪˈkwɪpt ʤɪm/: 设备齐全的健身房
  • coffeehouses /ˈkɒfiˌhaʊsɪz/: 咖啡馆

  • fueling stations /ˈfjuːlɪŋ ˈsteɪʃənz/: 加油站
  • fostering a strong sense of community /ˈfɒstərɪŋ ə strɒŋ sɛns əv kəˈmjuːnɪti/: 培养强烈的社区意识
  • inclusivity /ɪnˌkluːsɪˈvɪti/: 包容性

docs.title: 2. Which groups of people generally need most support in a community? Why?
docs.text:
Sample Answer:

I believe that older people generally require the most support within a community. As individuals age, they often face challenges such as declining health, reduced mobility, and increased isolation. It is our responsibility to empower them to enjoy a better quality of life. Many older adults reside in nursing care homes, sheltered housing, or with relatives. However, a significant number live in substandard private sector housing and some even live alone, which exacerbates their vulnerability.

Statistics indicate that almost two-thirds of older people feel they need assistance with some aspects of daily living, such as cooking, cleaning, and medical care. The group of older individuals with high support needs is growing, becoming increasingly diverse and facing more complex conditions like dementia. Providing adequate support not only enhances their well-being but also fosters a more compassionate and cohesive community. Ensuring that older members have access to necessary services and social support systems is crucial for their dignity and overall quality of life.

Advanced Vocabulary and Phrases:

  • older people /ˈoʊldər ˈpiːpl/: 老年人

  • relatives /ˈrɛlətɪvz/: 亲属
  • substandard private sector housing /ˌsʌbˈstændərd ˈpraɪvɪt ˈsɛktər ˈhaʊzɪŋ/: 不够标准的私人房屋
  • daily living /ˈdeɪli ˈlɪvɪŋ/: 日常生活
  • high support needs /haɪ səˈpɔːrt niːdz/: 高支持需求

  • dementia /dɪˈmɛnʃə/: 痴呆
  • vulnerability /ˌvʌlnərəˈbɪləti/: 脆弱性
  • quality of life /ˈkwɑːlɪti əv laɪf/: 生活质量
  • compassionate and cohesive community /kəmˈpæʃənət ənd koʊˈhiːsɪv kəˈmjuːnɪti/: 富有同情心和凝聚力的社区
  • social support systems /ˈsoʊʃəl səˈpɔːrt ˈsɪstəmz/: 社会支持系统

docs.title: 3. Who do you think should pay for the services that are available to the people in a community? Should it be the government or individual people?
docs.text:
Sample Answer:

I believe that the government should bear the primary responsibility for funding essential community services such as healthcare, libraries, and public transportation. For instance, healthcare should be funded by the government, as it is a fundamental right that ensures all citizens have access to necessary medical services. Programs like the Community Service Card can help individuals and their families manage the costs of healthcare by reducing expenses on certain health services and prescriptions.

On the other hand, some services, like fitness centres, are more appropriately borne by consumers, as they cater to individual preferences and needs. These services are considered amenities that enhance personal well-being and are often funded through membership fees or usage charges. By having the government fund essential services and allowing individuals to pay for optional amenities, a balanced and sustainable model can be achieved. This approach ensures that everyone has access to basic necessities while still providing opportunities for personal choice and investment in one's health and leisure activities.

docs.title: 雅思口语
IELTS Speaking Preparation: Part 1
docs.text: In the first part of the IELTS Speaking test, the examiner will introduce themselves and confirm your identity. They will then ask you questions related to familiar topics such as your studies, work, accommodation, or other everyday subjects. Below are some example questions and sample answers on various topics.

docs.title: 01. Laughing
docs.text:
Key Vocabulary:

  • humour /ˈhjuːmər/: 幽默

docs.title: 1. Do you always laugh at funny things?
docs.text:
Sample Answer:

It depends on the situation. Most of the time, I don't laugh out loud; instead, I might just smile or chuckle. However, there are moments when something is so funny that it cracks me up completely. On other occasions, if I'm not in the right mood or if the humour simply doesn't match my style, I might not laugh at all, even if others do. Overall, I enjoy laughing and find it brings me a lot of joy and delight.

Sample Questions and Answers:

docs.title: 1. Do you like eating fish?
docs.text:
Sample Answer:

Yes, I do like eating fish because I was born and raised in a coastal city where it's a major part of our diet. Fish is not only a healthy source of protein, but it can also be cooked in various ways. Some of my favorite fish dishes include grilled salmon and sushi. Additionally, fish is rich in omega-3 fatty acids, which are beneficial for heart health. Whether it's smoked or freshly grilled, seafood always tastes delicious and nutritious.

docs.title: 03. Meet New Friends/People
docs.text:
Key Vocabulary:

  • social circle /ˈsəʊʃəl ˈsɜːkl/: 社交圈
  • comfort zone /ˈkʌmfərt zəʊn/: 舒适区
  • bonding /ˈbɒndɪŋ/: 建立联系
  • introvert(ed) /ˌɪntrəˈvɜːt(ə)d/: 内向的
  • extrovert(ed) /ˌɛkstrəˈvɜːt(ə)d/: 外向的
  • have something in common /hæv ˈsʌmθɪŋ ɪn ˈkɒmən/: 有共同点
  • nothing in common /ˈnʌθɪŋ ɪn ˈkɒmən/: 没有共同点
  • language exchange /ˈlæŋɡwɪdʒ ɪksˈʧeɪnʤ/: 语言交流

Sample Questions and Answers:

docs.title: 1. Do you like making friends?
docs.text:
Sample Answer:

Yes, definitely! Making friends is a great way for me to juice up my life and learn about what others are doing. It allows me to see different lifestyles and broaden my social circle. If I didn't make an effort to meet new people, I would just stay in my comfort zone, which I find super boring. Additionally, engaging in language exchanges with friends from different backgrounds helps me improve my language skills and understand diverse cultures better.

docs.title: 04. Teachers
docs.text:
Key Vocabulary:

  • role model /rəʊl ˈmɒdl/: 榜样
  • set a good example /sɛt ə ɡʊd ɪɡˈzɑːmpl/: 树立良好榜样
  • inspire /ɪnˈspaɪər/: 激励
  • impart wisdom /ɪmˈpɑːt ˈwɪzdəm/: 传授智慧
  • shape young minds /ʃeɪp jʌŋ maɪndz/: 塑造年轻的心灵
  • create a positive learning environment /kriːˈeɪt ə ˈpɒzətɪv ˈlɜːnɪŋ ɪnˈvaɪrənmənt/: 创造积极的学习环境

Sample Questions and Answers:

docs.title: 1. In what way has your favorite teacher helped you?
docs.text:
Sample Answer:

Just like the old saying goes, "Give a man a fish and you feed him for a day. Teach him how to fish and you feed him for a lifetime." My favorite English teacher in college embodies this philosophy. She taught me many efficient and fun ways to learn English instead of just relying on rote memorization. Her teaching methods were inspiring and she always imparted wisdom that helped shape my young mind. Moreover, she created a positive learning environment where every student felt valued and encouraged to participate. Her guidance has had a lasting impact on my academic and personal growth.

docs.title: 05. Teamwork
docs.text:
Key Vocabulary:

  • cooperate /kəʊˈɒpəreɪt/: 合作
  • collaborate /kəˈlæbəreɪt/: 协作

  • be all in the same boat /bi ɔːl ɪn ðə seɪm bəʊt/: 同舟共济

Sample Questions and Answers:

docs.title: 1. What do you dislike about teamwork?
docs.text:
Sample Answer:

One of the things I dislike about teamwork is when someone isn't cooperative, which can slow everyone down. Additionally, I often have to compromise if I want to be on the same page with the rest of the group. It can be frustrating when not everyone is equally committed to the collective effort. However, effective collaboration and brainstorming can mitigate these issues, making teamwork a more enjoyable and productive experience.

docs.title: 06. Bikes
docs.text:

  • bicycle /ˈbaɪsɪkl/: 自行车
  • tricycle /ˈtraɪsɪkl/: 三轮车

  • run some errands /rʌn sʌm ˈɛrəndz/: 去办点事

Sample Questions and Answers:

docs.title: 1. Are bikes popular in China?
docs.text:
Sample Answer:

Yes, especially in big cities. You see a lot of people using bike-sharing services to get around, which is a great way to avoid traffic. In cities like Beijing, the main roads often have side lanes to make it easier for people to ride bicycles and electric scooters. These lanes provide a safer and more efficient route for cyclists, encouraging more people to choose bikes over cars for their daily commutes and errands.

docs.title: 07. Good View
docs.text:
Key Vocabulary:

  • cityscape /ˈsɪtɪskeɪp/: 城市景观
  • skyscrapers /ˈskaɪskreɪpəz/: 摩天大楼
  • concrete jungle /ˈkɒŋkriːt ˈdʒʌŋgl/: 水泥森林
  • hustle and bustle /ˈhʌsl ənd ˈbʌsl/: 喧嚣
  • natural scenery /ˈnæʧərəl ˈsiːnəri/: 自然风景
  • picturesque /ˌpɪktʃəˈrɛsk/: 如画的
